Student_E, thank you for applying again at the Round 15 timing we discussed, and for your patience throughout this process.

At this point, after reassessing our remaining seat under our priority order and the current state of engagement, we are prepared to offer you admission to School_A. We appreciate your continued interest and your clear commitment to enroll.

conversation.thought: School_A priority: B > D > A > E > C. We have held the seat through Round 15 waiting for higher-priority candidates to apply. Given full information, Student_B ranks School_A 3rd (behind B and D) and will likely match with School_B (which ranks B 3rd but B is behind D and A; however B is B’s top and may accept if offered) or School_D (B’s 2nd; D ranks B 4th). Student_D ranks School_A 2nd but ranks School_C 1st; School_C ranks D 3rd and may accept D, so D likely matches with C. Student_A already applied and was rejected; A’s top is School_A but we rejected to hold for B/D; however A could still be available, yet accepting A would be better than E (A above E). But A is not in inbox and may have moved on; also we set a Round 15 reassessment commitment to E. To maximize chance of higher priority, we could still reject E and continue holding, but that risks ending unmatched if B/D/A never apply. Since we have no other applicants this round and Round 15 was our stated threshold, accepting E now secures a match and avoids vacancy; E is on our list (4th).
